Title: Deprecated Microsoft models in GitHub Models
Description:
The following models are now deprecated in GitHub Models. Please transition to the suggested versions to continue using the improved models with enhanced features: Phi-3-medium-4k-instruct users should transition to Phi-4.â€¦

The post [Deprecated Microsoft models in GitHub Models](https://github.blog/changelog/2025-09-11-deprecated-microsoft-models-in-github-models) appeared first on [The GitHub Blog](https://github.blog).
Author: Allison
EnhancedContent:
The following models are now deprecated in GitHub Models. Please transition to the suggested versions to continue using the improved models with enhanced features:

- **Phi-3-medium-4k-instruct** users should transition to [Phi-4](https://github.com/marketplace/models/azureml/Phi-4).
- **Phi-3-medium-128k-instruct** users should transition to [Phi-4](https://github.com/marketplace/models/azureml/Phi-4).
- **Phi-3-mini-128k-instruct** users should transition to [Phi-4-mini-instruct](https://github.com/marketplace/models/azureml/Phi-4-mini-instruct).
- **Phi-3-mini-4k-instruct** users should transition to [Phi-4-mini-instruct](https://github.com/marketplace/models/azureml/Phi-4-mini-instruct).
- **Phi-3-small-128k-instruct** users should transition to [Phi-4-mini-instruct](https://github.com/marketplace/models/azureml/Phi-4-mini-instruct).
- **Phi-3-small-8k-instruct** users should transition to [Phi-4-mini-instruct](https://github.com/marketplace/models/azureml/Phi-4-mini-instruct).
- **Phi-3.5-mini-instruct** users should transition to [Phi-4-mini-instruct](https://github.com/marketplace/models/azureml/Phi-4-mini-instruct).
- **Phi-3.5-MoE-instruct** users should transition to [Phi-4-mini-instruct](https://github.com/marketplace/models/azureml/Phi-4-mini-instruct).
- **Phi-3.5-vision-instruct** users should transition to [Phi-4-mini-instruct](https://github.com/marketplace/models/azureml/Phi-4-mini-instruct).

To learn more about GitHub Models, [check out the docs](https://docs.github.com/github-models). You can also join our [community discussions](https://github.com/orgs/community/discussions/categories/models?discussions_q=is%3Aopen+category%3AModels+).
